intro: Eyrea vernalis, commonly known as the spring bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes various bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or meadow habitats. Its showy, blue to purple flowers bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Eyrea vernalis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits in garden and natural settings.
